Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "What is the registry location for the android sdk manager in VS2017 15.7.4 and later installed on Windows OS machine?" (#1935) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, 

As described in the below StackOverflow link, we used the below mentioned "Android SDK registry location" to find the Android SDK installed location on Windows OS machine in our application for a long time. 

**StackOverflow:**
1.  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51100309/registry-key-file-is-not-found-for-android-sdk-tools-in-vs2017-15-8-preview-1-1
2.  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51191349/how-to-find-android-sdkmanager-installed-path-in-windows-os-with-visual-studio-2

**Android SDK registry location:** HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Android SDK Tools

From Visual Studio 2017 15.7.4 and later, we could not see the above stated "Android SDK registry location". Instead, we could see the below registry entry in some machines but not in German OS.

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Xamarin\VisualStudio\15.0_b8627b83\Android 

In some machines, we could find the registry entry here. 

HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1415224841-4160497810-138773753-3121\Software\Xamarin\VisualStudio\15.0_b8627b83\Android

Due to this, our application throwing exception and we could not use our application anymore.

Also, we found that there were some changes in SDK installations along with Visual Studio 2017 15.7 versions as mentioned in below link. Is this affect the Android SDK installed location in the registry?
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releasenotes/vs2017-relnotes#install2
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releasenotes/vs2017-relnotes#xamarin-sdkmanagement

Could you please let us know how to find android SDK installed location from the registry entry which should be common for all language Windows OS machines?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "What is the registry location for the android sdk manager in VS2017 15.7.4 and later installed on Windows OS machine?" (#1935) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, 

As described in the below StackOverflow link, we used the below mentioned "Android SDK registry location" to find the Android SDK installed location on Windows OS machine in our application for a long time. 

**StackOverflow:** https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51100309/registry-key-file-is-not-found-for-android-sdk-tools-in-vs2017-15-8-preview-1-1

**Android SDK registry location:** HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Android SDK Tools

From Visual Studio 2017 15.7.4 and later, we could not see the above stated "Android SDK registry location". Instead, we could see the below registry entry in some machines but not in German OS.

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Xamarin\VisualStudio\15.0_b8627b83\Android 

In some machines, we could find the registry entry here. 

HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1415224841-4160497810-138773753-3121\Software\Xamarin\VisualStudio\15.0_b8627b83\Android

Due to this, our application throwing exception and we could not use our application anymore.

Also, we found that there were some changes in SDK installations along with Visual Studio 2017 15.7 versions as mentioned in below link. Is this affect the Android SDK installed location in the registry?
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releasenotes/vs2017-relnotes#install2
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releasenotes/vs2017-relnotes#xamarin-sdkmanagement

Could you please let us know how to find android SDK installed location from the registry entry which should be common for all language Windows OS machines?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Resource not found errors on new Forms Android project" (#1934) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Forms project.
2. Run NuGet update.
3. Build the Android project.

### Expected Behavior

Project builds.

### Actual Behavior

Get the following errors:

```
Error APT0000: Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'Theme.AppCompat.Light.DarkActionBar'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'colorAccent'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'colorPrimary'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'colorPrimaryDark'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'windowActionBar'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'windowActionModeOverlay'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'windowNoTitle'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'Theme.AppCompat.Light.Dialog'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
Error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'colorAccent'. (APT0000) (_3152.Android)
```

I've now seen this on new projects in VS for Mac _and_ VS for Windows, and occasionally on older projects that I've opened up in both.

Target Android version for the new project is 8.1 (27), with minimum version set to 4.4 (19).

I've also seen a community report of this problem (https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/3152). 

The error messages appear to be the same ones as #1696.

### Version Information

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DeleteBinObj issue with Resources" (#1933) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Somehow when testing/building [Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/42c07d1ae5aa56eb574b7d169499f1a9af7ec080/Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android)
2. I randomly get an `APT0000` error
3. `Rebuild` fixes it

I am not exactly sure what step I did to _cause_ this, the error I get is:

```
"C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android\Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.csproj" (default target) (1) ->
(_UpdateAndroidResgen target) ->
  Resources\layout\NativeAndroidCell.axml(3): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'background' with value '@drawable/CustomSelector'). [C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android\Xamarin
.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.csproj]
  Resources\layout\NativeAndroidListViewCell.axml(3): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'background' with value '@drawable/CustomSelector2'). [C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Androi
d\Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.csproj]

    7 Warning(s)
    2 Error(s)
```

It could be related to opening the solution in VS for Windows?

In `obj\Debug\res` I see both `customselector.xml` and `customselector2.xml`.

### Expected Behavior

I should not have to `Rebuild` here, this seems to be a DeleteBinObj issue.

### Actual Behavior

I have to `Rebuild` for the project to build.

### Version Information

I was using xamarin-android/master as of: 3558fd2a5dadf7b6a9eb9750f33196e593359312

### Log File

I zipped up the project, `obj`, `bin`, and `msbuild.binlog`: https://www.dropbox.com/s/6l5ak1mlqybw9k5/Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.zip?dl=0

_NOTE: Github had a 10MB limit_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[tests] fix for BuildAppWithManagedResourceParserAndLibraries timeout" (#1892) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/nunit/docs/wiki/Framework-Parallel-Test-Execution#specifying-parallelism-at-multiple-test-levels
Context: http://xamarin-jenkins/job/monodroid-pr/397/

On Jenkins (monodroid builds) a test can fail with:

    1) Failed : Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.AndroidUpdateResourcesTest.BuildAppWithManagedResourceParserAndLibraries
        DesignTime build should be less than 10000 milliseconds.
        Expected: less than or equal to 10000.0d
        But was:  12820.0d

But this test is marked with `[NonParallelizable]`, what is going on?

Looking at NUnit's documentation, we have this test configured as:

    Parallel class with non-parallel methods: The methods run
    sequentially, usually on the same thread that ran the class one-time
    setup, but may actually be running in parallel with other, unrelated
    methods from other classes.

Since the test class has `[Parallelizable (ParallelScope.Children)]`,
if we mark `BuildAppWithManagedResourceParserAndLibraries` as
`[NonParallelizable]` it can still run in parallel with methods of
other test classes!

So the only way to fix this is:
- Make the test class `[NonParallelizable]`
- Mark each method `[Parallelizable]`, which defaults to a scope of
  `ParallelScope.Self`

Then we get the configuration we want in this case:

    Non-parallel class with parallel methods: The methods only run in
    parallel with one another, not with the test methods of any other
    classes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] set VSIX compression level to Normal" (#1932) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
While generating a VSIX, I noticed this in the build log:

    CreateVsixContainer:
      Creating VSIX Container...
      Creating the package with the following compression level. "NotCompressed".

Changing the `ZipPackageCompressionLevel` property to `Normal`, seems
to change the VSIX so it is properly compressed.

The file size goes from 584991368 bytes to 172998318 bytes.

It's worth doing this, just to make the download smaller in the OSS
repo. I need to do some further research and make sure the VSIX we are
shipping commercially is compressed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Wrong header separator with AndroidClientHandler" (#1931) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
```csharp
var client = new HttpClient();
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.UserAgent.Add(new ProductInfoHeaderValue("Product", "1.0.0"));
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.UserAgent.Add(new ProductInfoHeaderValue("(comment) extra"));
```
### Expected Behavior
User-Agent must be `Product/1.0.0 (comment) extra`. For iOS, NSUrlSessionHandler does it right.

### Actual Behavior
User-Agent is `Product/1.0.0,(comment) extra`

### Version Information
Xamarin.Android SDK   8.3.3.2 (HEAD/dffc59120)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NetworkOnMainThreadException in AndroidClientHandler on cancellation" (#1588) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
Unfortunately, I'm not able to reproduce this error myself as it works fine on my devices. I got the error report from App Center.

### Expected Behavior
Cancelling HTTP task from main thread should not cause NetworkOnMainThreadException. Actual HTTP task is launched from another thread.

### Actual Behavior
```

```
### Version Information
This happens on devices from KitKat to Nougat. No info on Oreo.

App has been built on App Center with Xamarin.Android 8.2, Mono 5.8.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[UWP] Fix CornerRadius rendering on Frame" (#3239) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This PR fixes issue #2838 - CornerRadius rendering for Frame control on UWP. This occurs for `Frame` elements with a set background color and `CornerRadius`. In current release this causes the background to protrude through the rounded corners, which means the corners essentially remain square.

The fix provides a custom override of the `VisualElementRenderer`'s `UpdateBackgroundColor` method in UWP `FrameRenderer`.

### Issues Resolved ###

- fixes #2838 

### API Changes ###

N/A

### Platforms Affected ###

- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

`Frame` with `CornerRadius` and a background color will now render properly on UWP.

### PR Checklist ###

- [] Has automated tests (visual verification)
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Visual Studio 2017 and Xamarin Forms Issues" (#3236) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
If i try to create a Xamarin.Forms (3.1)  project in Visual Studio 2017, it fails with below issues.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Certain NSObject AddObserver overloads cause cause a SIGSEV" (#4410) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This appears to have been confirmed over a year ago, but never followed up on: https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=52476.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add an observer to an `NSObject` using the Xamarin `AddObserver` overloads that takes a function as an argument.

### Expected Behavior

Receive observer notifications normally.

### Actual Behavior

A warning in the logs, followed by a thread crash as soon as the observer executes. Note that in my usage, nothing should be deallocated so I'm not sure why the error message about `Dispose` shows up (the view is still on screen, and the object being observed is a persistent ivar). The crash occurs even with a completely empty observer method.

I would also add that the way in which the app "crashes" is also completely unexpected. The app freezes, but there is no other indication that something is wrong unless you look at the logs. Not a fan of how the runtime handles this.

### Environment

```
=== Visual Studio Community 2017 for Mac ===

Version 7.5.3 (build 7)
Installation UUID: 588f3763-d580-45de-b809-10d8518368e1
Runtime:
	Mono 5.10.1.57 (2017-12/ea8a24b1bbf) (64-bit)
	GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme)
	Xamarin.Mac 4.4.1.178 (master / eeaeb7e6)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Runtime] Emit the AssemblyRegistration event" (#4414) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: A typo was preventing it from being emitted.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Question: Support for loading XM projects in VS for Windows?" (#4413) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The title really says it all here. I want to open and edit (*not* build) a Xamarin.Mac project on my PC in Visual Studio for Windows. I've seen conflicting evidence as to whether or not this is possible. [This stackoverflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41126995/open-xamarin-mac-project-in-visual-studio-on-pc-without-attaching-to-mac) indicates that it is only possible in very limited circumstances, yet does not fully state what those circumstances are. On the other hand, the mere existence of #4341 implies that this is supported. Which is it, and what gotchas should I be aware of?

I understand that Xamarin.iOS applications are fully supported in VS for Windows, yet that is not the kind of app I am writing. I also understand that the nib file editor won't work in VS for Windows, but that doesn't matter all that much because I am going to be writing a "Nibless" application as described in the XM docs (mainly due to low annoying and clunky the process for editing Mac nibs in VSMac is). Thanks for the clarification!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NSHttpCookieStorage.CookiesChangedNotification is mapped to NSHTTPCookieManagerAcceptPolicyChangedNotification" (#4412) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an iOS project with a webview and navigate to any url that has some cookies set
2. Subscribe to ```NSHttpCookieStorage.CookiesChangedNotification``` through the ```NSNotificationCenter.DefaultCenter.AddObserver```
3. Subscribe to ```NSHttpCookieStorage.AcceptPolicyChangedNotification``` through the ```NSNotificationCenter.DefaultCenter.AddObserver```

4. Delete any cookie using NSHttpCookieStorage.SharedStorage.DeleteCookie

### Expected Behavior
the Action passed into registration in step 2 is fired
the Action passed into registration in step 3 is not fired
### Actual Behavior
the Action passed into registration in step 3 is fired
the Action passed into registration in step 2 is not fired

The MediaPlayer framework is new on WatchOS most changes are just adding the attr for the correct watch version.  I had issues binding MPMediaEntity in an intelligent way due to the number of #if statements we have. Would appreciate feedback on how do that in a smarter way.
